apparmor.description: In all versions of AppArmor mount rules are accidentally widened when compiled.
apparmor.name: CVE-2016-1585

notes: no fix as of 2020-10-19

release_states: Ignored (end of ESM support, was deferred)

cups.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in Security Update 2022-003 Catalina, macOS Monterey 12.3, macOS Big Sur 11.6.5. An application may be able to gain elevated privileges.
cups.name: CVE-2022-26691

curl.description: [libcurl would reuse a previously created connection even when a TLS or SSH related option had been changed that should have prohibited reuse.]
curl.name: CVE-2022-27782

notes: Affects curl versions 7.16.1 up to and including 7.83.0

dpkg.description: Dpkg::Source::Archive in dpkg, the Debian package management system, before version 1.21.8, 1.20.10, 1.19.8, 1.18.26 is prone to a directory traversal vulnerability. When extracting untrusted source packages in v2 and v3 source package formats that include a debian.tar, the in-place extraction can lead to directory traversal situations on specially crafted orig.tar and debian.tar tarballs.
dpkg.name: CVE-2022-1664

e2fsprogs.description: An out-of-bounds read/write vulnerability was found in e2fsprogs 1.46.5. This issue leads to a segmentation fault and possibly arbitrary code execution via a specially crafted filesystem.
e2fsprogs.name: CVE-2022-1304

freetype.description: FreeType commit 1e2eb65048f75c64b68708efed6ce904c31f3b2f was discovered to contain a heap buffer overflow via the function sfnt_init_face.
freetype.name: CVE-2022-27404

notes:
vulnerable code was actually introduced in commit
https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/freetype/freetype/-/commit/63765a8f
(version 2.8), the commit in the description is the commit
used to sync and test the reproducer.

gcc-9.description: Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation."
gcc-9.name: CVE-2020-13844

notes: gcc-3.3 only provides libstdc++5

gcc-defaults.description: Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation."
gcc-defaults.name: CVE-2020-13844

notes: gcc-3.3 only provides libstdc++5

release_states: Ignored (end of ESM support, was deferred)

gdk-pixbuf.description: GNOME gdk-pixbuf 2.42.6 is vulnerable to a heap-buffer overflow vulnerability when decoding the lzw compressed stream of image data in GIF files with lzw minimum code size equals to 12.
gdk-pixbuf.name: CVE-2021-44648

notes: as of 2022-05-26, proposed fix not commited upstream

imagemagick.description: In WriteOnePNGImage() of the PNG coder at coders/png.c, an improper call to AcquireVirtualMemory() and memset() allows for an out-of-bounds write later when PopShortPixel() from MagickCore/quantum-private.h is called. The patch fixes the calls by adding 256 to rowbytes. An attacker who is able to supply a specially crafted image could affect availability with a low impact to data integrity. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 6.9.10-68 and 7.0.8-68.
imagemagick.name: CVE-2020-25664

notes:
fix attempt was reverted
unclear what the fix for this issue is as of 2021-06-10

imagemagick.description: A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/quantum-private.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger a heap buffer overflow. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially lead to an impact to data integrity as well. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.
imagemagick.name: CVE-2020-27752

notes: need to clarify exact patch, see Debian comment on upstream bug

krb5.description: ec_verify in kdc/kdc_preauth_ec.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.18.4 and 1.19.x before 1.19.2 allows remote attackers to cause a NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash. This occurs because a return value is not properly managed in a certain situation.
krb5.name: CVE-2021-36222

krb5.description: The Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.18.5 and 1.19.x before 1.19.3 has a NULL pointer dereference in kdc/do_tgs_req.c via a FAST inner body that lacks a server field.
krb5.name: CVE-2021-37750

notes:
this vulnerability was introduced by commit 39548a5, as
established by upstream. Prior to this commit, an error
would occur instead of the null deference. In the patch
notes, the CVE is described as affecting releases 1.14
and later only (meaning that xenial and trusty are not
affected by this).

libxml2.description: In libxml2 before 2.9.14, several buffer handling functions in buf.c (xmlBuf*) and tree.c (xmlBuffer*) don't check for integer overflows. This can result in out-of-bounds memory writes. Exploitation requires a victim to open a crafted, multi-gigabyte XML file. Other software using libxml2's buffer functions, for example libxslt through 1.1.35, is affected as well.
libxml2.name: CVE-2022-29824

openldap.description: In OpenLDAP 2.x before 2.5.12 and 2.6.x before 2.6.2, a SQL injection vulnerability exists in the experimental back-sql backend to slapd, via a SQL statement within an LDAP query. This can occur during an LDAP search operation when the search filter is processed, due to a lack of proper escaping.
openldap.name: CVE-2022-29155

openssl.description: The c_rehash script does not properly sanitise shell metacharacters to prevent command injection. This script is distributed by some operating systems in a manner where it is automatically executed. On such operating systems, an attacker could execute arbitrary commands with the privileges of the script. Use of the c_rehash script is considered obsolete and should be replaced by the OpenSSL rehash command line tool. Fixed in OpenSSL 3.0.3 (Affected 3.0.0,3.0.1,3.0.2). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1o (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1n). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2ze (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2zd).
openssl.name: CVE-2022-1292

notes: Fix is in cpanpm 2.29

sqlite3.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows 7.19. A malicious application may cause a denial of service or potentially disclose memory contents.
sqlite3.name: CVE-2020-9794

notes:
This may be an Apple-specific CVE, as of 2021-02-08, no details
are available as to what the upstream fix is.

release_states: Ignored (end of ESM support, was needs-triage)

tiff.description: Reachable Assertion in tiffcp in libtiff 4.3.0 allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted tiff file. For users that compile libtiff from sources, the fix is available with commit 5e180045.
tiff.name: CVE-2022-0865

tiff.description: A heap buffer overflow in ExtractImageSection function in tiffcrop.c in libtiff library Version 4.3.0 allows attacker to trigger unsafe or out of bounds memory access via crafted TIFF image file which could result into application crash, potential information disclosure or any other context-dependent impact
tiff.name: CVE-2022-0891

tiff.description: libtiff: heap-buffer-overflow in TIFFReadRawDataStriped() in tiffinfo.c
tiff.name: CVE-2022-1354

unzip.description: A flaw was found in Unzip. The vulnerability occurs during the conversion of a wide string to a local string that leads to a heap of out-of-bound write. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted zip file, leading to a crash or code execution.
unzip.name: CVE-2022-0529

notes: main bug is private, no details available as of 2022-05-26

vim.description: vim is vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read
vim.name: CVE-2021-4166

notes:
code in bionic and earlier does not include file src/arglist.c, which
is the patched file. The patched code for these releases seems to be
instead present in src/buffer.c, as seen in commit 4ad62155a10.
Changes that led to the creation of file arglist.c and changes made
to the code that follow the creation of this file are significant,
which would result in an intrusive backport should the altered CVE
patch and other necessary changes be applied in bionic and earlier.
Consequently, the issue will be marked as ignored for the previously
mentioned releases.

vim.description: vim is vulnerable to Use After Free
vim.name: CVE-2021-4192

vim.description: vim is vulnerable to Heap-based Buffer Overflow
vim.name: CVE-2022-0213

notes:
in bionic and earlier vulnerable code is in src/screen.c
instead of src/drawscreen.c

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0261

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0318

notes:
the patch for CVE-2022-0318 causes one of the utf8 tests to
start failing, which in turn causes build failures as well.
Commit fc6ccebea66 addresses this issue and updates the test.

vim.description: Out-of-bounds Read in vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0319

vim.description: Access of Memory Location Before Start of Buffer in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0351

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0359

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0361

vim.description: Out-of-bounds Read in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0368

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0392

notes: vulnerable function introduced in ec2da36ca48 (>= 8.0.0210).

vim.description: Stack-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0408

notes:
in bionic and earlier, vulnerable function is in src/spell.c
instead of in src/spellsuggest.c.

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0417

notes:
this CVE involves code that was introduced in version 8.1.0105
of vim. Part of the patched code was introduced in version
8.2.3402, which is the fix for CVE-2021-3770. The vulnerability
related to this other CVE also does not affect bionic and
earlier.

vim.description: Use of Out-of-range Pointer Offset in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0554

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0572

notes:
for bionic and earlier, vulnerable code can be found in file
src/ex_cmds.c instead of src/indent.c (does not exist in bionic
and earlier).

vim.description: Stack-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0629

notes: vulnerable code introduced by commit 865767126e9 (>= 8.1.0819).

vim.description: Use of Out-of-range Pointer Offset in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4418.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0685

notes:
for bionic and earlier, the vulnerable function is found in file
src/misc1.c instead of src/filepath.c.

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4436.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0714

notes:
in bionic and earlier, vulnerable code can be found in src/edit.c
instead of src/indent.c.

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow occurs in vim in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4563.
vim.name: CVE-2022-0943

notes:
in bionic and earlier, vulnerable code can be found in src/spell.c
instead of src/spellsuggest.c.

vim.description: Use after free in utf_ptr2char in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4646.
vim.name: CVE-2022-1154

notes:
in bionic and earlier, vulnerable function is in file src/regexp.c
instead of file src/regexp_bt.c.

vim.description: Use of Out-of-range Pointer Offset in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4774.
vim.name: CVE-2022-1420

notes:
vulnerable functions introduced by commit 22a0c0c4ec
(>= 8.1.1834).

vim.description: Use after free in append_command in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4895. This vulnerability is capable of crashing software, Bypass Protection Mechanism, Modify Memory, and possible remote execution
vim.name: CVE-2022-1616

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in function cmdline_erase_chars in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4899. This vulnerabilities are capable of crashing software, modify memory, and possible remote execution
vim.name: CVE-2022-1619

vim.description: NULL Pointer Dereference in function vim_regexec_string at regexp.c:2729 in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4901. NULL Pointer Dereference in function vim_regexec_string at regexp.c:2729 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted input.
vim.name: CVE-2022-1620

vim.description: Heap buffer overflow in vim_strncpy find_word in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4919. This vulnerability is capable of crashing software, Bypass Protection Mechanism, Modify Memory, and possible remote execution
vim.name: CVE-2022-1621

notes:
for xenial and earlier, patched file should be src/spell.c
instead of src/spellfile.c.

vim.description: Buffer Over-read in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-1927

vim.description: Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-1942

vim.description: Use After Free in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.
vim.name: CVE-2022-1968

wget.description: GNU Wget through 1.21.1 does not omit the Authorization header upon a redirect to a different origin, a related issue to CVE-2018-1000007.
wget.name: CVE-2021-31879

notes:
no upstream fix as of 2022-01-05
also see previous upstream bug from 2019
